1.verse: From: Sha’ul, a prisoner for the sake of the Messiah Yeshua, and brother Timothy To: Our dear fellow-worker Philemon,

2.verse: along with sister Apphia, our fellow-soldier Archippus and the congregation that gathers in your home:

3.verse: Grace and shalom to you from God our Father and the Lord Yeshua the Messiah.

4.verse: I thank my God every time I mention you in my prayers, Philemon,

5.verse: for I am hearing about your love and commitment to the Lord Yeshua and to all God’s people.

6.verse: I pray that the fellowship based on your commitment will produce full understanding of every good thing that is ours in union with the Messiah.

7.verse: For your love has given me much joy and encouragement. Brother, you have refreshed the hearts of God’s people.

8.verse: Therefore, I would not hesitate, in union with the Messiah, to direct you to do the thing you ought to do.

9.verse: But since I Sha’ul, am the kind of person I am, an old man and now for the Messiah Yeshua’s sake a prisoner besides, I prefer to appeal to you on the basis of love.

10.verse: My request to you concerns my son, of whom I became the father while here in prison, Onesimus.

11.verse: His name means “useful,” and although he was once useless to you, he has now become most useful — not only to you but also to me;

12.verse: so that in returning him to you I am sending a part of my very heart.

13.verse: I would dearly have loved to keep him with me, in order for him to serve me in your place while I am in prison because of the Good News.

14.verse: But I didn’t want to do anything without your consent, so that the good you do for me may be voluntary and not forced.

15.verse: Perhaps the reason he was separated from you for a brief period was so that you could have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave but as more than a slave, as a dear brother. And that he is, especially to me. But how much dearer he must be to you, both humanly and in union with the Lord!

17.verse: So if you are in fellowship with me, receive him as you would me.

18.verse: And if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to me.

19.verse: I, Sha’ul, write with my own hand. I will repay it. (I won’t mention, of course, that you owe me your very life.)

20.verse: Yes, brother, please do me this favor in the Lord; refresh my heart in the Messiah.

21.verse: Trusting that you will respond positively, I write knowing that you will indeed do more than I am asking.

22.verse: One more thing: please get a room ready for me. For I hope that through the prayers of you all God will give me a chance to visit you.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner for the sake of the Messiah Yeshua, sends greetings to you,

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow-workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Yeshua the Messiah be with your spirit.
